dialogue: Eliana's outside. Sorry about the hood, Mrs. Paiva. Cigarette?
Where is my husband?
How long have you been married?
I want to see him.
Here it says eighteen years. Was he associating with communists back then?
My husband was in the Labor Party, and I'd like to call my lawyer.
No need. These are just routine questions.
I'll answer them after I see my daughter and my husband.
He's upstairs. He's already told us everything he knows. You just need to confirm.
Confirm what?
That he left the country in '64 for conspiring against the revolution.
Rubens was a congressman. He was ousted and had to go into exile. But since he came back, he hasn't been involved in politics.
So why is he still fraternizing with terrorists?
He never-- A desperate cry is heard outside the room.
I'll take that cigarette now.
Rubens is an engineer, a husband and father. He's got nothing to do with terrorists.
We've been keeping an eye on the comings and goings at your house for a while now, Mrs. Paiva.
We like having friends over.
And are any of those friends here?
No.
Mrs. Paiva, all I'm trying to do is make sure you can keep taking care of your home, driving your kids to school and playing your backgammon. That's my job.
How's Vera doing in London?
Did you do something to my daughter?
Did she do anything wrong?
Of course not. What sort of a question is that?
Well, then there's nothing to worry about. Shall we try again?
Who is this man?
Rubens.
See, it's not that hard. Who else do you recognize?
Look carefully.
That's Martha, my daughters' teacher. What is she doing here?
Her son provides logistics for the subversives in Chile.
What does Rubens have to do with any of this?
Martha was intercepted at the airport yesterday, bringing letters for your husband. I want to know how he delivers them to the terrorists.
I told you, Rubens has nothing to do with terrorists.
Ma'am, you'd better start rethinking your attitude.
Will I see my daughter now?
But you said that If I answered--
-We're not done yet.
Why the handcuffs?
It's protocol.
Where are you taking me?
Your turn, Eliana.
Have you seen my husband? They said he was upstairs. He's in a shirt and tie. He's got a mustache.
His name is Rubens. Please, help me. I need to see him. Please.
Rubens!
